item.title: Trump Suspends Mexico Tariffs on USMCA Goods for a Month

item.title: Roy Ayers, Vibraphonist Who Injected Soul Into Jazz, Dies at 84

item.title: Conflict-of-interest questions surface as CFPB stripped of its power to regulate Elon Musk’s X
item.description: Social media site hopes to get into the payments business.

item.title: Trump Is Said to Be Preparing Executive Order That Aims to Eliminate Education Dept.
item.description: Without Congress, President Trump cannot dismantle the agency. No modern president has ever tried to unilaterally shut down a federal department.

item.title: BP CEO sees pay cut 30% after profit miss, Elliott intervention
item.description: Murray Auchincloss is in the middle of a roadshow meeting with investors in London in the hope of enlisting support for the company’s new direction.

item.title: Trump team tests job candidates by asking who won the 2020 election
item.description: Job seekers are also asked their views on the events of Jan. 6, 2021.

item.title: Musk and Milei’s chainsaw maker Is crafting another for Trump
item.description: Argentina's Mariano 'Tute' Di Tella is thrilled that the custom chainsaws filling his one-bedroom apartment have come to symbolize radical change.

item.title: Trump’s E.P.A. to Rewrite Rules Aimed at Averting Chemical Disasters
item.description: The Biden-era rules require thousands of hazardous-chemical sites to adopt new safeguards against storms, spills and other risks.

item.title: Universities that anticipate funding losses from Elon Musk’s DOGE cuts are yanking back admission offers to graduate students
item.description: Universities like the University of Pennsylvania are cutting back on graduate admissions programs in preparation of federal funding decreases.
